ColumnA: 0.5 g stool is emulsified in 10 mL Sheather’s solution (56% sucrose in distilled water) using wooden sticks and manual shaking, followed by 30 minutes of sedimentation
ColumnB: 0.8–1 g (formed) or 2 mL (liquid) stool is added directly into the Ultra Sample Reagent bottle

ColumnA: The supernatant (0.5 mL) is mixed with the Ultra Sample Reagent
ColumnB: After incubation and sedimentation, the supernatant is used for Xpert testing similar to sputum testing

ColumnA: The procedure has a moderate risk for generating aerosols and should be performed in a biosafety cabinet
ColumnB: The procedure has a low risk for generating aerosols and can be performed using the same precautions as for Xpert MTB/RIF or Ultra on sputum
